dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees are tall and thick. The wind is blowing lightly tall and thin looking figure stands with his back against tree. This is DURZA, an almost human-like person except for his maroon eyes and crimson hair. Durza closes his eyes and draws his sword up in front of face. The WIND blows again. Durza SNIFFS and then opens his eye

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Spread out and hide! Stop whatever it is coming this way...or die! Suddenly, behind Durza, twelve URGALS, men-like creatures with bowed LEGS and ARMS. They also have two curved HORNS above their small ears. They begin to shuffle around. After a moment, each of the Urgals hide down beneath the bushes and behind the trees. Durza peers around the tree and looks up a small PATH tha goes through the forest. A GUST OF WIND blows across the forest. Durza sniffs, smiles, and then leans back against tree.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: (Grunting) Get ready! An Urgal moves and a TWIG snaps. Durza hisses with rage. After a moment, three WHITE HORSES emerge from the darkne at the end of the path. Two MALE ELVES sit on the right and left horses, one FEMA ELF, ARYA, a beautiful black haired woman who looks to be her late twenties, is on the center horse. The three Elves draw closer to Durza. The WIND BLOWS towa the horses. They jump up on their back legs and then drop back down on all fours. The two male elves look frightened and then their horses start galloping. Arya's horse bolts forward and leaves th two male-elves behind. All of the Urgals jump from their hiding spots and draw Bows. They launch black ARROWS at the two male-elves, who fall their horses, dead. Durza jumps out from behind the tree and lifts his hand i the air.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Garjzla! A FIRE-BOLT launches from Durza's hand and hits Arya's ho which is a couple hundred feet away. Arya jumps off the horse and lightning speed and lands on ground lightly. Her horse falls down into the dirt beside her. Quickly, Arya gets up and bolts off of the path and into woods at inhuman speeds.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: After her! All of the Urgals run after Arya. Durza looks all around. spots a large piece of GRANITE sticking up into the sky. climbs it. Once he gets to the top of the Granite piece, Durza looks over the treetops. He raises his hand up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Ilstari boetk! A quarter mile section of the forest explodes into flames Arya is running swiftly, the trees in front of her explod into flames. She quickly turns and runs in another direct

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Ilstari boetk! Another quarter mile section of the forest burst into fla Arya turns and runs in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Ilstari boetk! A third quarter mile section of the forest burst into fla creating a ring of fire. Durza looks out over the large ring of fire. Suddenly, t sounds of screaming Urgals are heard. He looks down again. Three of the Urgals fall down to the ground, dead. Durza looks down at Arya, who is running toward him at a swift pace. The remaining Urgals are chasing her. Durza peeks over the edge twenty-foot high granite piece then jumps to the ground, right in front of Arya. Arya turns and runs in the other direction, but the Urgal surround her. She turns and looks for another way out, bu there is none. Durza points at Arya and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: Get her! The Urgal's charge in. Arya pulls a pouch out of her pock and opens it up. She reaches inside and pulls out a beautiful SAPPHIRE STO and raises it above her head and quietly mumbles somethin the ANCIENT LANGUAGE. A flash of light comes from the sto Durza raises his hand toward Arya.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: (Angry) Garjzla! A fire-bolt comes from his hand and hits Arya. She collap to the ground. Durza runs over to Arya and looks at her hands. The stone gone. Durza howls rage and throws his sword at a tree. It stick half way though. He then begins screaming. He raises his hand and shoots n bolts of fire at the remaining Urgal. They all drop dead instantly. He walks over to Arya and lifts her off the ground with e He throws her over his shoulder and then pulls his sword the tree. Durza walks back to his horse and gets on, putting Arya behind him. He puts the fire in front of him out and bolts off into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large MOUNTAINS surround a small FIELD. ERAGON, an averag looking fifteen-year-old boy with dark eyebrows and brown eyes, kneels down and places his hand on a spot of trampl GRASS. After a moment, Eragon stands to his feet and begins to w toward a large FOREST that rest on the side of the mounta Eragon stops right at the edge of the forest and sighs. H pulls his BOW off of his back and knocks an ARROW. He wal into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments, Eragon comes to a quiet stop. He get down on his knees. A large HERD of DEER sit in a small opening in the forest DOE is limping around on the edge of the herd because of broken leg. Eragon smiles and pulls the arrow back. He aims for a mom and then... A huge flash of light blast out of the middle of the herd The deer jump up and run franticly. Eragon releases the arrow but it misses the deer. Eragon stands up. He has a surprised and confused look on his fa He walks over to where the light had come from. A ring of grass is burnt. The beautiful Sapphire Stone from before in the middle of the ring. Eragon hesitates in fear. After a moment, he grabs the st and examines it. It has little WHITE VEINS that run all o it like a Spiderweb. He drops his PACK off his back and onto the ground. He op it and carefully places the Stone inside. Eragon looks around and then stands to his feet. He walks of the small opening and back into the forest. Eragon fin large tree and throws a blanket out at the trunk of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN peeks over the tops of the tall mountains. Eragon opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is walking down a small, dirt road. After a moment comes to the edge of a hill. Down at the bottom of the hill, maybe a mile away, rest CARVAHALL, a small village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks down the street of Carvahall. He stops and a building and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small BUTCHER is standing behind a counter toward the b of the room. He's cutting meat. This is SLOAN, a man in h early 40s. He has a constant angry look in his eyes. Eragon walks up to the counter. Sloan stops cutting the m and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: (Sarcastic) So...the mighty hunter joins the rest of us! How many did you bag this time?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: I'm amazed! And that's why you've come? Well lets see your money, then!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don't exactly have any, but I do-

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: (Angry) ; . So you want me to just give the meat to you?! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOAN(cont 'd) Do you see any of the other Merchants giving away their wares? Besides, its late. I'm closed. You'll have to come back tomorrow with money.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I can't wait until tomorrow, Sloan. It'll be worth your while, though; I found something to pay you with. Eragon sets his pack down on the counter and pulls the Sapphire Stone out. He holds it in front of Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: Stole it is more like it. Sloan goes back to chopping his meat.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I didn't steal it! I found it in the Spine when I was hunting! Sloan looks up in surprise at the mention of the Spine. H slams his KNIFE down onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: You get out of my store, boy! And take your cursed rock with you! Eragon doesn't move, but stands there in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: Go before I make you! Suddenly, a tall, thick man walks into the building. This HORST, a rough looking man. Behind him is KATRINA, a beautiful young woman with long, blonde hair.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: What's going on here, Sloan?

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: This...boy came in here badgering me. I asked him to leave, but he want budge. I even threatened him!

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: (To Eragon) Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I offered him this stone for payment and he agreed. when I told him that I got it from the Spine, he wouldn't sell it to me!

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: I have no love for the Spine myself, Sloan, but when it comes to the worth of the rock, I'll back it with my own money.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: No. It's my store, I'll do what I want with it! Katrina steps out from behind Horst.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Daddy, Eragon is willing to pay. Just give him the meat so we can have dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: You stay out of this, Katrina! Go back to the house. Katrina doesn't movie.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN
dialogues.text: Now! Katrina storms out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Fine! I'll pay for it. Eragon, what were you going to get?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: As much as I could.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Give me your finest steaks. And make sure its enough to fill Eragon's pack. Sloan hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: HORST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not selling to me would be a very bad idea. Sloan scowls and then slips into a back room. The sounds CUTTING and WHACKING and slight mumbling is heard. Eragon looks up at Horst.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Oh...its really no trouble. Eragon holds the rock up to Horst

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I guess this belongs to you.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: (Chuckling) No..you keep your strange rock. As for payment, Albriech is leaving in the Spring to become a Master Smith. You can work off the debt over the spring. Sloan walks back into the room with a large sack of meat. sets it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Horst walk out of Sloan's store.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot! Roran wanted me to get a message to Katrina, can you give it to her?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: He wants her to know that he'll come into town as soon as the merchants arrive and that he’1ll see her then.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: That all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Embarrassed) No. He also wants her to know that she is the most beautiful girl he has ever seen and that he thinks of nothing else. Horst face breaks into a large grin. He winks at Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Getting serious, isn't he? Eragon smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I better be getting back. Garrow's expecting me. Eragon begins to walk down the street. He waves farewell Horst after a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon's small WOODEN HOUSE sits in the middle of a large field. Eragon walks toward it slowly. A small flicker of light can be seen in the window of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks into the house with a dragging pace. He look very tired. He walks into the small KITCHEN and sets his pack on the TABLE. A small, pale man walks into the Kitchen. This is GARROW, hungry looking old man.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where's Roran?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Sleeping. Eragon pulls the meat out of his pack and sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: What's this? Did you buy meat? Where'd you get the money?  10.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Horst paid for it.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: (Angry) ; I told you I won't accept charity Next they'll be asking if we need anything else! We may as well just move to town!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I didn't accept charity. Horst told me I could work it off at his forge this coming spring.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: And where do you think you'll find time for that? Are you just going to ignore everything that needs to be done around here? There is a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don't know how I'll do it. Besides, I found something that could be worth some money. Eragon reaches into his pack and pulls the Sapphire Stone and sets it on the table. Garrow bows over it. His face turns ravenous, and his han start to twitch.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: You found this in the Spine?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Yes. It just appeared while I was hunting. Came out of no where. It scared all the deer off, too. Garrow looks over the Stone for a few more moments.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Anyway, its good to be home, uncle.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: I'm glad your back. But you should get some rest. We're leaving early in the morning so we can get to the traders in time.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks into his room. He sets his pack down on the floor beside the wall and walks over to his bed. The Sapp Stone is in his hand. He looks at it for a moment and then places it under his and then goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just beginning to rise over the peaks of the Mountains that surround GARROW'S FARM. Smoke rises from t CHIMNEY on top of Eragon's house. Snow lies over the ground and in the tree's and on the to Eragon's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks into the kitchen. He YAWNS and STRETCHES and then sits down at the table. Garrow is sitting at one end RORAN, a nine-teen year-old man. Each of them have a piec meat on their plate. Eragon begins to eat his food.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: The snow that came last night might slow us down...

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Still, we should be able to make it in time. After a moment, Garrow looks up from his plate and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Today is a...special day. Eragon and Roran look up from the plates and stop eating.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: It was near this very hour, sixteen years ago, that Eragon's mother, Selena, showed up at my door...pregnant. She spent a few months with me then had you Eragon.  12. Eragon takes a bite of his meat and then looks back up at Garrow.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She begged me and Marian to raise you. When I asked why..."I must" was all she could say. Then she left. There is a long silence after Garrow's story.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: So what's this I hear about a strange rock?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Come and see. Eragon and Roran both get up and walk out of the Kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon comes through the door. Roran walks in behind Erag The Sapphire Stone is sitting under Eragon's bed, where h had left it. Eragon reaches under his bed and grabs the Stone. He holds it up for Roran to grab it. Roran hesitates for a moment and then takes the Stone fro Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: It's beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: GARROW, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We'd better leave now if we're going to catch the traders! Eragon grabs his pack of the ground and carefully puts th Sapphire Stone into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENTS line the front of Carvahall. Hundreds of people wal around looking at various things. A WAGON, being pulled by horses, comes over a small hill rides down toward the group of tents. The wagon stops to the side of all the tents. Eragon and Roran jump off the wagon. Garrow slowly climbs down the s of the wagon.  13. Garrow puts his hands in his pocket and pulls out a few coins. He divides it up and then hands the coins to Erago and Roran.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Get yourselves some treats. Roran, do what you want, but be back at Horst house for dinner. Eragon come with me. Roran walks away and disappears into the crowd. Eragon an Garrow walk the opposite way. Eragon and Garrow walk up to a MAN who is standing behind table, showing off his KNIVES and SWORDS. This is MERLOCK rough looking merchant. After a moment, Merlock notices Eragon and Garrow. He the sets the sword down that he was holding and walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: And what would you fine sirs be looking for? Maybe a sword? Or maybe- He turns quickly and grabs a perfectly crafted SILVER ROS from the table. He holds it up in front of Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A silver rose for a special lady friend, eh?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Actually, we aren't looking to buy. We're looking to sell.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: I see...do you have the item with you?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Yes, but we'd much rather show somewhere more...private.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Oh, I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merlock comes through the entrance of the tent, Eragon an Garrow come in behind him.  14. Merlock picks up a stack of books off of two chairs and gestures toward them.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Please...have a seat. Eragon and Garrow sit down.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Show him the Stone, Eragon. Eragon hesitates but then pulls the Stone out of the pack hands it to Merlock. Merlock looks at it with an interested eye. He pulls a bo out and opens it. He takes a small hammer and starts to t it and do other various things to it. After a few moments stops.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Do you know how much this is worth?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, neither do I. But I will tell you this much: it's unlike anything I've ever seen. It won't scratch. Whoever made it used tools I've never seen-or maybe magic. And it’s hallow.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard a rock that sounds like this? Merlock gets the small hammer and taps the rock. It echo' slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: But what is it worth!?

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: I can't tell you that. For most people, this would be an item of curiosity-not an item to spend money on. Everything is silent for a few moments.  15.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Will you buy it?

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: No...it’s not worth the risk. I may be able to find a wealthy buyer during my spring travels, but even so, you'll have to wait until next year before you'll get paid. (Beat ) I am curious however...why did you want to speak to me in private?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Because, I found this in the Spine. People around here don't care to much for the place.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Do you know why me and my fellow traders were late this year? Eragon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our wanderings have been dogged with misfortune. Chaos seems to rule Alagaseia. We can't seem to avoid illness, attacks, and the worse black luck. Because the Varden's attacks against the Empire, Galbatorix is calling more men to the border. Men who are needed to fight the Urgals. Merlock stops and picks up and drinks a CUP of WATER.

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: And even worst, there's talk of a Shade, though the stories are unconfirmed. Not many people survive such an encounter.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why haven't we heard of this?

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Because, these things have just happened in the past few months.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: Nonsense! We haven't seen any Urgals. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARROW(cont 'd) The only one around here has his horns hooked to the wall in Morn's tavern!

dialogues.speaker: MERLOCK
dialogues.text: Maybe so...but this is a small village that's hidden by mountains. No surprise that you haven't been noticed yet. But if you haven't noticed, strange things are happening, especially after the appearing of that rock appearing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrow is walking swiftly through the thick crowd toward entrance to Carvahall. Eragon is walking behind him, tryi to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to get more information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horst, Eragon, Garrow, Roran, and various other people si around a large, wooden table. Everyone is laughing and ea and drinking. MORN, a rough looking man, leans forward with a dark look his eye. Everyone gets quiet.

dialogues.speaker: MORN
dialogues.text: There's strange people around here. Grain buyers who cheat everyone out of their money. (Breat) They're telling ridiculous stories about how the Varden had made a pact with the Urgals and planned to attack us. And how it was only for the great King Galbatorix that we haven't already be over taken by their armies.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: If they keep it up, there's gonna be trouble.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: For who?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: For them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of people gather around a huge BONFIRE. Eragon Garrow, and Roran walks up to the group of people. A DARK FIGURE, BROM, an older man with a large beard and bushy eye brows, stands right beside the BONFIRE. Everyon looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Before your grandfathers fathers were born, and even before their fathers were born, the Dragon Riders were formed. To protect and guard was their mission. And for thousands of years, they succeeded. Their prowess in battle was unmatched. Each of the Riders had the strength of ten men. The crowd is now completely quiet. Only the sound of Brom of the BONFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They were immortal. Only for good were their powers used. And as they kept the peace, the land flourished. It was a golden time. The Elves were our allies, the Dwarves our friends. But it could not last. Though no enemy could defeat them, they could not guard against themselves. (Beat ) And it came to pass, that in the golden age of Alagaesia, Galbatorix was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALBATORIX (10) is fighting, with a sword, a RIDER. After moment, Galbatorix hit's the Rider's sword out of the his hands.  18.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: At the age of ten, he was tested, and the Riders found great power in him. The riders accepted him as their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galbatorix, now 17, is flying through the air on the back a large BLACK DRAGON. On the ground below him there is a group of Urgals. The Black Dragon dives toward the group.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: After his training was complete, he took a reckless trip with two friends into the remaining territory of the Urgals. Galbatorix is slaughtering the Urgals with his sword. The Black Dragon is overtaken by Urgals and is falls to the ground, dead.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: He killed his attackers, but tragically, his dragon was killed in the battle. And thus the seeds of madness were planted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galbatorix is wandering through a large grass plain. Afte moment, he falls down to the ground, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: For months, he wandered, seeking death, but it did not come. He was found and summoned to the Riders to be judged. He demanded another dragon, but the desperation in his voice revealed before the Council what he truly was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom is standing in front of the fire, looking around at crowd.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Denied his hope, Galbatorix, through the twisted mirror of madness, came to believe that it was the Riders fault that his dragon had been killed. And so, night after night, he brooded on this, and planned his exact...revenge... (Beat ) Through some ill fortune, he met a Rider named Morzan. Morzan was strong in body, but weak in mind. (Beat ) They slaughtered every Rider they came in contact with. With each kill, their strength grew. Twelve of the Riders joined them because of the desire for power. After this, Galbatorix named himself King over Alagasesia. He's ruled us ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Roran are sitting in the back of the WAGON, Ga is in the front, controlling the horses. Eragon sits stil He looks as if he is in deep thought.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: You two are very lucky to have heard that story. He's only told it twice, and if the Empire knew he had, he wouldn't live to see another month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small candle on Eragon's DRESSER lights the room. He pu the Sapphire Stone out of his pack and sets it own his be He pulls out a small, wooden HAMMER and taps it. After a moments of tapping it in different places, he shakes his head, sets the Stone on his dresser, and climbs into his Quickly, his eyes close and he falls asleep. DARKNESS... A loud SQUEAK is heard.  20. A candle is lit and Eragon's room comes into view. Eragon holding it. He sets the candle down on his dresser and lo around. The SQUEAK is heard again. It's coming from the Sapphire Stone. Eragon turns around and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Whispering) I've got nothing but trouble ever since I found you...and now you won't even let me sleep! Eragon gets back in his bed and closes his eyes. The Ston SQUEAKS again. And it begins to ROCK. Eragon sits up in h bed and scowls.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Whispering) I don't care how valuable you are! I'm gonna destroy you! CRACKS begin to appear on the Stone. Eragon stands still, looks at it. Entranced. More CRACKS appear, and run strai to the top of the Stone. After a moment, a small piece at the top of the Stone bre away from the rest, and falls to the floor. A small HEAD appears pokes out of the hole in the top of Stone! Eragon steps back from the stone. After a moment, a shado body is standing beside the stone. Eragon looks shocked. It's a baby DRAGON! It's no longer Eragon's forearm, and its SCALES are deep SAPPHIRE BLUE. After a moment, the dragon begins look around and walk ar the dresser. Eragon reaches out with his hand and touches it on the ba A blue FLASH comes from the dragon and launches Eragon ba onto the floor. Eragon lets out a scream. After a second, Eragon gets up the floor and listens to make sure no one is coming. Eragon's hand turns red. He begins to scratch it, but sto and looks at his palm in fear. A large blue OVAL appears the skin of his palm. A few moments later a COLLAGE of VOICES can be heard. Era puts his hands on his head and closes his eyes.  21. A few seconds later he throws his hands down. The voices stop. Eragon is out of breath. Eragon quietly walks out of his room and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon opens a large box and pulls out a long strip of ME He walks back toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Ah...here we go. (Beat ) Now...what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Well, I've heard a lot about the Dragon Riders and their great accomplishments, and most everyone wants them to return. But I've never heard any stories about how they were started and what made them so special.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: A vast subject to tell about. If I were to tell you the whole story we'd still be sitting here next winter. lights it witha  23. Brom sucks on his pipe and lets out a smoke ring.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I'll start with the last item...Dragons. Eragon settles back in his chair and sips his tea.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dragons have no beginning, unless it lies with the creation of Alagaseia itself. And if they have an end, it will be when this land perishes. dialogues.text: Where did the elves come from?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: (Scowling) Did you want your first question answered or not?!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Embarrassed) Sorry. Brom chuckles under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No, your not. (Beat ) If you must know, the elves come from a place they call Alalea. No one knows what, or even where it is. Brom sucks on his pipe again and lets out another smoke r

dialogues.text: In fact, you were named after an elf. The first Dragon Rider, to be specific. Eragon sits up - his eyes wide open.  24.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Ah...so you didn't know your namesake?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: No. Eragon looks confused. Brom stands up and walks out of the room with his tea cup After a moment, he returns with a full cup of tea. He sit down on his chair and takes a sip of tea.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Do you remember any of the dragon names?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Hmm...lets see...there was Jura, Hirador, and Fundor-who fought the giant sea snake. Galzra, Briam, Ohen...umm...Beroan... Brom stops for a moment and lets a large smoke ring float into the air.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: (Whispering) And Saphira... Eragon sits back for a moment. He then sets his tea cup d on a small TABLE that is beside him and then stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Well, it's getting late and I should get back...

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: (Curious) Eragon? Why the sudden interest in Dragons and such?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Umm...I heard a couple of...traders talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.text: He offered me a job at the Mill. If I accept, I'll leave with him when he returns for the sockets.. to take the job. .I plan A few moments of silence pass. Garrow leans back in his chair.

dialogues.text: Why?  26.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: Well...I plan to marry Katrina, and I can't do that without any money.

dialogues.text: I see. A few more moments of silence pass.

dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Umm...there was Ingothold...wait a second! Your not a he...your a she, aren't you. The dragon sets its head down on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, lets see then...I don't remember any na--wait--are you...Saphira?

dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.text: The sun is rising above the trees. Snow covers the ground Eragon, Roran, and Garrow are standing on the front porch

dialogues.text: Eragon and Roran have packs on. Garrow is standing by the door with a sad look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: Won't you come with us?

dialogues.speaker: GARROW
dialogues.text: No...no...I have...things to do. Garrow holds out his hand and places money into Roran's h Roran smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GARROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It isn't much, but that and a fathers blessing is all I have to give. Roran embraces Garrow for a moment and then turns and wal off the porch. Eragon follows him.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I do, but why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: AS soon as you get home, get rid of it. looks shocked and worried.

dialogues.text: Thank you for telling me. Would you happen to know where these men are?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: (Stern) I didn't warn you ‘cause I thought you needed to talk to them! Leave Carvahall. Go home!  30.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Alright, if you think I should.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: I do. (Beat ) I may just be overreacting, but these strangers give me a bad feeling.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I'll leave right now. Eragon turns and runs inside of the Smithy.

dialogues.text: Eragon comes through the door and embraces Roran.

dialogues.speaker: RORAN
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to stay a little while longer? Eragon laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.text: Well, alright. I guess this is the last time we'll be seeing each other for a few months.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.text: A few weeks ago. Eragon turns back around and hides behind the wall.

dialogues.text: Are you sure? If are somehow mistaken, it will be most...unpleasant.

dialogues.text: (Shaken) Yeah, I'm sure. He had it then. Everyone knows about it. Go ask them!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.text: Why did you do this?! Garrow needs our help!

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Murderers!

dialogues.text: You take me on this ridiculous journey when Garrow needs us, and your scales have scrapped the skin of my legs! Is that what you wanted!

dialogues.text: No. Eragon lets his head fall to the ground.

dialogues.text: I will take you because of a debt owed. But into foolishness we fly.  37. Eragon looks up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON

dialogues.text: Fallow the road. It'll give you enough room to land.

dialogues.text: Find yourself a place to hide. You'll have to take care of yourself for a while.

dialogues.text: Well enough, where's Garrow?

dialogues.text: Over at Horst's house. There wasn't enough room to keep you both here.

dialogues.text: How is he? There is a long silence.

dialogues.text: Not good. He has a fever that refuses to break, and his injuries aren't healing.

dialogues.text: (Whispering) Saphira!
