dialogues.text: Now can I see Garrow?

dialogues.speaker: GERTRUDE
dialogues.text: You're a determined one, aren't you? (Beat ) Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horst large, two story house, sits on a large hill.  42. Eragon and Gertrude are slowly walking toward it. Eragon leans against Gertrude as he limps along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Gertrude are standing on Horst's porch. Gertru knocks on the door. A few moments pass and then Horst's wife, ELAIN, a woman her late thirties, comes to the door

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: (Softly) Please, come in. Eragon and Gertrude follow Elain into the house. They sto once they are in the LIVING ROOM. Elain gives Eragon a sad smile, and then looks at Gertrud

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: I was about to send for you. He isn't doing well. You should see him right away.

dialogues.speaker: GERTRUDE
dialogues.text: You'll have to help Eragon up the stairs. Gertrude hurries up the stairs that are right behind her. Eragon slowly walks over to the steps. As he puts his foo the first step, Elain reaches out to help him.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: It's OK, I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Elain pulls her arm back. Eragon slowly takes a step up t the next step. He winces in pain. Elain holds her arms ri behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrow's deformed body is lying on a small bed in the cor of the room. Gertrude is examining Garrow. She has her ha on his forehead.  43. Eragon slowly walks into the room. Elain following right behind. Eragon walks over to the bed. He looks at Garrow's burnt face. A tear rolls down his cheek. Katrina is standing by the fireplace in another corner boiling rags. Eragon lifts the blankets that cover Garrow's stomach. Th are bandages covering all over him. Gertrude takes on of off. A large burn mark is seen for a moment, and then Gertrude puts another bandage on. Eragon looks at Gertrude with hopeless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Can't you do anything?

dialogues.speaker: GERTRUDE
dialogues.text: I've tried everything. But still, things could change for the better He's a strong man. Eragon turns and looks out a small window in the room. Elain walks up behind Eragon and puts her hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: You should leave for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I want to stay.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you can come back. Why don't you come down and get some of my fresh apple pie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Elain walk into the kitchen. Horst is sitting the table eating a slice of pie. Eragon walks over to the table and sits down. Elain bring him a slice of pie and a glass of milk.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon takes a bite of the pie.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Terrible. Eragon takes a few more bites.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: I know this isn't the best time, but we need to know.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: ...what happened.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don't really remember. Horst leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: HORST
dialogues.text: Eragon, I was one of the people who went to your farm. Your house didn't just burn down. Something tore it to pieces. Eragon takes a few more bites of his food and then, slowl stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I'm tired. I'm going back to Gertrude's house to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: Why don't you stay with us?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Do you have enough room?

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: Of course! Come with me, I'll get everything ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is lying in a bed that's just like Garrow's.  45. A few moments pass and then Gertrude comes in through the door. Eragon opens his eyes and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: GERTRUDE
dialogues.text: Well, the fever's gone and some of his burns are healing. (Beat ) He'll be fine. You go on to sleep. Eragon pulls his blankets up to his neck and then closes eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon jolts upright. He is breathing hard and sweat is layered across his forehead. The SOUNDS of people mumbling can be heard down the hallw Eragon slowly gets up from his bed and walks out into the hallway. Garrow's door is open and people are gathered around. Eragon looks pale as he walks to Garrow's room. Everyone makes room for Eragon to get through. They all look sad. Garrow is lying his bed. He has a new pair of clothes on his hands are crossed over his stomach. Tears begin to fl out of Eragon's eyes. Elain rushes over to Eragon and put her arms around him. After a few moments pass, Elain guides Eragon back to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elain stops at the door and watches Eragon lay down on hi bed. After a moment, she walks over to the bed and stands beside him. Eragon raps up with his blankets. His eyes are full of te

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: He didn't deserve this! Elain's hand touches Eragon's head. Eragon continues to c  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is sitting by the window. Tears flow down his chee

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I can't live with this.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Then don't.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What would you have me do? Garrow's gone forever!

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Your heat is the only guide to the answer. Eragon looks confused for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do...pursue the strangers?

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Eragon sits there, silent.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Am I strong enough for this?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: You have me. (Beat ) There is nothing left for you here. And there's nothing more dangerous than an enemy with nothing to lose. And that is the very thing you have become. A few moments pass and then Eragon looks at the door

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I will go. Eragon stands up. He slightly winces but walks over to hi bed without problem. HE grabs his pack off the floor and it on the bed. He opens it and packs a pair of clothes in  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon quietly walks down the stairs. He then walks over the door and listens.

dialogues.speaker: ELAIN
dialogues.text: ...place to stay. We have room. Eragon sighs and then quietly walks over to the front doo He looks back and then, quietly, walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon stays low as he walks off the porch and down the street. No one else is outside. Eragon stops at Sloan's Butcher S He looks around and then, quietly, enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon looks around as he walks behind the counter. He sp a large slab of meat and walks over to it. Eragon bends down and grabs the meat and quietly slides i into his Pack. After a moment, he looks around, and then walks out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks off the porch and starts walking down the street.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Going somewhere? Behind Eragon stands Brom. Eragon swiftly turns around in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I hope you have enough meat for our dragon.  48.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Afraid) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Don't fool with me. I know where that mark, gedwey ignasia: shining palm, on your palm comes from: you have touched a dragon hatchling. I know why you came to me with all of those questions.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Confused) How'd you find out?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: There were clues and hints everywhere. All I had to do was pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Saphira, we've been found out! I need you! Saphira does not answer. Eragon looks very confused and frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I've talked with her. She has agreed to hover over us until we settle our differences.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: How could you tal-

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Now tell me, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I was going to...find a safe place for me to rest while I heal.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: And after that.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I...I was going to hunt down the strangers and kill them.  49.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: A mighty task for one so young. Certainly a worthy endeavor and one you are fit to carry out. Thought it strikes me that help would be unwelcome. Brom walks over to a large BUSH and pulls out a large PAC He puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm not going to sit around while some stripling gets to run around with a dragon. A few moments pass.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don't need help, but you can come.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Well then we had best be going. (Beat ) I think you'll find that you're dragon will listen to you now.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Saphira?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira soars through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Will you meet us at the farm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira turns and dives downward a bit

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So you've come to an agreement?  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon looks up at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira flies toward the ground and then levels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon adjust he Pack.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: They're probably looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Probably. Shall we go?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I want to leave a letter with Ror-

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: It's already been taken care of. I sent a letter to him explaining a few things. Satisfactory? Eragon simply nods and they begin to walk down the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira dives towards the ground. Brom and Eragon can be standing by the ruins of Eragon's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira lands, smashing the grass underneath her feet.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: What's it's name?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Saphira. A pleasure look crosses Brom's face.  51.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Of all the names you gave me, its the only one she liked. (Beat ) I think it fits. A moment passes. Brom has an unreadable look on his face. Eragon waits for a moment, and then walks into what is le of his house. He searches for the spot that his room once was, and find it. He looks around for a moment, and then finds his BOw. It's a little scuffed up, but it's not unusable. He looks around for a bit more and finds his QUIVER. The leather isn't harmed at all. He smiles, satisfied. After a moment, Eragon walks over to Saphira and Brom.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Where to now?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: We find a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Do you have a place in mind?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Yes. Eragon straps his Quiver to his Pack with a ROPE and then puts it on his back.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Follow me. Saphira jumps into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, irregular clearing is right in the center of the forest. Eragon and Brom walk into the clearing. Saphira lands rig in the center of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Does anyone else no about this?  52.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: No. I found it when we first moved here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is now a FIRE in the center of the clearing. Brom a Eragon are sitting by it. Saphira is curled up around the Brom is quietly smoking his pipe and looking into the fir

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why do you want to travel with me? A ring of smoke rises from Brom's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I have vested interest in keeping you alive.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: To put it bluntly, I'ma storyteller and I think you'll make a fine story. (Beat)s Eragon, you're the first dragon Rider to exist out of the king's control in over a thousand years. What will happen you? Will you die a martyr Join the Varden? Or will you k King Galbatorix? All fascinating questions. And I will be there to see every bit of it. A few moments pass. Eragon gazes into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: That may be, but tell me, how can you talk to Saphira. Brom takes a few moments to put more TOBACCO into his pip

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Very well. If it's answers you want, its answers you'll get, but they may not be to your liking. Brom stands up and walks over to his Pack near the edge o the clearing. He picks it up and sets it down by the fire  53. He then opens the Pack and pulls out a long OBJECT, aroun three feet long, that is wrapped in CLOTH. Slowly, Brom pulls the cloth away from the object, revell a SWORD. The Sword has a golden handle that has a red RUBY the siz a bird egg engraved in it. It's BLADE is crimson red. After all of the cloth is pulled away, Brom hands the Swo to Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: This was once a Riders blade. It's name is Zar'roc. Eragon swings it around a few times.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it? Brom takes a few moments and then answers.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. All I will say is that it took me many nasty and dangerous adventures to attain it. Eragon swings it one more time.

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Consider it yours. You have more of a claim to it than I do. And before all is done, I think you will need it. Eragon holds the sword up and looks at the blade.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: It is a princely gift. I'm honored. Brom walks over to his Pack and pulls out a BELT with a l SHEATH on it. He walks back to Eragon and hands it to him Eragon takes it and slowly slides the sword into it.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Now, if you must know, anyone can learn to speak to a dragon, with the right knowledge. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROM(cont 'd) I know more about dragons than almost everyone else alive...I'm offering my knowledge to you as a shortcut, for by yourself, it would take you years to learn. How I know so much, I will keep to myself. Eragon and Brom sit down by the fire again.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Do you have knowledge of the strangers?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. They are called the Raz'ac. They weren't seen before Galbatorix was king. Little is known about them, but I can tell you one thing: they aren't human. When I glimpsed one of their heads I saw something that resembled a beak and they have small, beady eyes. How they manage to speak our tongue baffles me. Brom lights his pipe and sucks in smoke, and lets it out ring.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: As for their powers, they are stronger than any man and can jump incredible heights, but they cannot use magic. Be thankful for that, for if they could, you would probably already be in their grasp.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: As far as I know, only the two you've seen. But there could be more.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why were they searching for Saphira?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: They're the king's personal dragon hunters. Whenever rumor of a dragon or dragon egg is heard by the king, he sends them to search for it.  55. Everything is silent for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that scar on your head?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I was sneaking around the Raz'ac's campsite one night, trying to find as my information about them as I could, when they surprised me from the shadows. I managed to get away, but not without this token of my stupidity. Eragon lays back and looks into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: When you saw the scar on my palm, why didn't you warn me about the Raz'ac? I could have warned Garrow.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: (Apologetic) I was unsure of what to do at the time. I thought I could keep the Raz'ac away from you until they left, and then confront you about Saphira. But they outsmarted me. Its a mistake that I deeply regret and has cost you dearly. Eragon sits up with a demanding look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Who are you!? I've trusted you this far because Saphira respects you but no more! Why does a storyteller happen to have a Riders blade? Why do you know so much about the Raz' ax?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I thought I made it clear I wasn't going to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: My uncle is dead because of you! Dead! You're not the person I've known all these years. Explain yourself!  56. A few long moments pass as Brom lets out smoke rings from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: You probably haven't thought about it, but most of my life has been spent out of Carvahall. I've played many roles to many people. I've a complicated past.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Then who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I'm someone who wants to help you- do not scorn those words, for they are the truest I've ever spoken. But I will not answer your questions.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I'm going to sleep. Eragon looks at the stars for a moment, and then closes h eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon opens his eyes. A few tears run down his cheeks. A a moment, he wipes them away and stands up. Brom is cooking breakfast over the fire. Eragon walks ove and sits down by the fire, with his hands under his armpi

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Good morning. Eragon grunts in reply. After a few moments, Eragon stand and walks over to his pack. He pulls out a large piece of leather.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Make a saddle for Saphira.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Oh... (Beat ) Well lets see, there are two types of saddles for dragons. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROM(cont 'd) One that takes time and tools to make, two things we don't have, and one that is nothing more than a layer between the rider and the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Do you know what they look like?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Better, I can make one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom ties two final straps of leather together and then stands up, holding a completed saddle. HE walks over to Saphira. She bends down a little, allowing Brom to put th saddle on her back. Brom walks over to Eragon and looks at Saphira.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Thank you... Brom walks over to the fire. Eragon turns to follow him, stops when Saphira says-

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to try it out?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Maybe tomorrow. It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom and Eragon are lying down by the fire. Brom is smoki his pipe and Eragon is staring into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Eragon, I'm sorry for the way things turned out. I didn't mean for any of this to happen. Eragon doesn't respond and avoids Brom's eyes. A few mome pas.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: We'll need to get horses in Therinsford tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: You do, but I have Saphira.  58. Brom shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I can't keep up with a dragon, and it'll be safer if we travel together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is gray and the wind is blowing. Eragon and Brom are walking through the forest. Eragon's sword, Zar'roc, is tied to his waist. Saphira soars over the forest and then darts into the clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom are walking through a large field. A few miles ahead the large village of THERINSFORD can be seen. The buildings and HOMES sit in no particular order and lo fairly run down. Eragon and Brom stop and look at it in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom walk down the crowded street. A young BOY runs past Brom. Brom turns and grabs the Boy by the shoulder. The Boy tur around and looks at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Do you know where we can buy horses? The Boy points up the street, where a small barn can be s

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors are open to the barn. Horse stalls line each si of the building all the way to the back.  59. A middle-aged man, HABERTH, is grooming a beautiful white stallion, SNOWFIRE. Eragon and Brom walk into the barn. Haberth looks up at t as they walk over to him.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: That's a beautiful animal.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. It's name is Snowfire. Mine's Haberth. Brom and Haberth shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: We need two fast horses with a full set of tack for both. Haberth walks to the back of the barn and grabs two saddl off the wall. He sets them on the ground. Haberth walks over to a BAY horse. He also looks at the B in the stall beside the first.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: Will these do? Brom looks at the first Bay.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: We'll wake him. Brom looks at the second.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: The other, I'm not so sure of.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: He's got a good pair of legs on "em.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Mmm...how much will you take Snowfire? Haberth glances at Snowfire.  60.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: I do not wish to sell him. He's the finest I've ever bred.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: If you were willing to part with him, how much would all this cost me? Haberth doesn't respond for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HABERTH
dialogues.text: 200 coins, no less. Brom pulls out a bag of coins and counts through it. Afte moment, he hands it to Haberth.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Will this do? Haberth looks in the bag of coins and then at Snowfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brom is leading Snowfire down the street by his reigns an Eragon is guiding the Bay. Brom quickly leads Snowfire into a small ALLEY between tw houses. Eragon follows him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Take Snowfire and go to the far side of Therinsford. Wait for me there. Brom hands Eragon the reigns to Snowfire. Eragon looks at reigns, still confused.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why? Brom is already gone. Eragon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is standing right outside the SIDE GATE to Therins with Snowfire and the Bay. After a moment, Brom walks through the gate and to Eragon Brom grabs Snowfire's reigns and begins to walk away from Therinsford.  61.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is walking toward the edge of the forest, holding Bay's reigns. Brom is behind him, guiding Snowfire. After a moment, Eragon and Brom enter the forest. Brom ju onto Snowfire's saddle. Eragon looks at the Bay, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Hurry, we have far to go. Eragon slowly mounts the Bay and looks at Brom. Brom nods head and then Snowfire begins to walk through the forest. Eragon struggles to get the Bay to move, but after a mome they begin to walk behind Brom.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: The Raz'ac have defiantly been through here. A man back in town told me. He said they fled like demons from a holy man.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: But why would they come through therinsford?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Apparently to get horses, like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom ride their horses into a small clearing, then slide off the saddles and look around. Eragon turns and looks at the Bay.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: You should name him. Eragon rubs the side of the Bay's face.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don't have anything as majestic as Snowfire, but maybe this'll do. Eragon pauses for a moment  62.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I name you Cadoc. Eragon looks at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: It was my grandfathers name. Brom nods, approvingly. Eragon sits down and arranges a small pile of tender. Suddenly, Saphira crashes through the trees and lands in clearing. Eragon and Brom look at her.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How do the plains look?

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dull. Only Rabbits and small shrub can be seen for miles. Eragon shakes his head and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Catch! A wooden sword cracks into Eragon's forehead. Eragon yelp pain and grabs his head. Eragon looks up at Brom, who is flying toward him with hi own sword. Eragon jumps out of the way and grabs the wooden sword Br had thrown at him. Brom, obviously better than Eragon, smacks Eragon on the of the leg with the sword. Eragon falls to the ground and yelps.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Brom plunges toward Eragon again, and cracks the wooden b of his sword across Eragon’s chest. Eragon gasp’s for air falls down again.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Are you mad?!  63.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Well you can’t just go fight the Raz’ac! Look at you! Can’t even stay on your feet. Eragon stands up and grabs his wooden sword. He runs towa Brom and swings the sword at him. Brom quickly dodges the attack and slaps Eragon on the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just rising over the tree tops. Eragon and Sap are sleeping. Brom quickly runs over to Eragon and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Eragon, wake up. And then walks over to his backpack and continues to pack things up. Eragon slowly opens his eyes and slowly sits up, wincing the pain in his body. He grunts.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Good morning. Eragon scowls.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I just want you to be ready when we find them... Eragon slowly stands to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I won’t be able to move if we meet them, much less fight! Behind him, Saphire picks her head up off the ground. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: We need to get a move on it. We’ve got a mile to go before we reach the plains.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is riding Cadoc and Brom is on Snowfire. They are quickly traveling downhill. EXT. THE PLAIN’S - DAY Eragon and Brom, on their horses backs, come out of the forest and stop at the edge of the plains. To the right of Eragon and Brom about a half a mile away, ANORA RIVER can be seen. It stretches off in the opposite direction of Brom and Eragon. Brom points at it-

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: That’s the Anora River, and our only source of water from until we reach Yazuac, which is where, I think, the Raz’ac have gone.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where’s that?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Due east, and four days away, if all goes well. It’s a small village by the Ninor River. Sapphire lands abruptly beside Brom and Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There’s no where to hide on the plains. I’1l have to fly above you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom ride across the plains on Cadoc and Snowf with great speed. A small village, YUZUAC, can be seen a a mile ahead of them. Behind Yuzuac is the NINOR RIVER. Saphire lands by the river and ducks down to hide. EXT. THE PLAIN’S - DUSK Eragon and Brom stop about one hundred feet away from Yuzuac’s front GATE.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: It’s quiet.  65.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Doesn’t mean anything, though.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: No dogs bark. They should must have seen us by now.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Yes, they should have.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Could be a trap.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Still, we need provisions.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don’t think we should do it.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: We have to. But not like fool...

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Well, if there is an ambush, it would be at the front gate. So...

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: We enter from the back Brom draws his sword and sets it across his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom slowly ride into the city on their horses Eragon is behind Brom. A few moments of silence pass and then they come around a corner. Right in front of them is a pile of dead bodies. Eragon covers his noes and looks away. Brom closes his ey in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Who would do this?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: The Urgal’s.  66. Eragon looks down at the pile. Lying in the pile is a lifeless middle-aged woman. She is holding tightly to her dead baby. Tears form in Eragon’s eyes. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Do you want to wait outside the city until I’m done?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: No. I’m fine. Brom looks around for a moment. Suddenly, two Urgal’ jump of nowhere and attack Brom. They each have AXES. Brom fights back with his sword, with obvious skill and knowledge of the blade. After a moment, one of the Urgal’s Axes hacks into Brom’s arm. He screams. Eragon begins to panic.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What do I do? what I do? Suddenly, Eragon jumps off of Cadoc, holding his sword, Zar’oc, and starts running toward them, screaming in fear rage. The Urgal’s look surprised, but turn and begin to defend themselves. After a few moments of fighting, Eragon turns runs away, leading the Urgal’s into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon runs into the alley and realizes its a dead-end. H turns around, but the Urgal’s already have him cornered. Eragon drops his sword and pulls his BOW and ARROW from h back. He aims it at the Urgal. Eragon fires, but it hits Urgal’s shield. Eragon gets another arrow and aims it at the Urgal’s agai He closes his eyes and lets out a deep breath. After a moment, he lets the string go and screams-

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Brisingr!  67. The arrow lights on fire with a blue flame and hits the l Urgal in the forehead. A shock-wave of blue explodes from arrow and kills all the other Urgal’s, but passes through Eragon. Eragon looks surprised at what he just did. He looks at t symbol on his palm. It’s glowing brightly. He bends down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon runs over to Brom and helps him off his horse. Era looks at Brom’s arm. It’s badly damaged. Eragon closes his eyes and looks up for a moment. After a few moments pass, Saphira lands in the street in rage.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Where are the ones who did this? I’1l rip them apart!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: They’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You killed them? Eragon nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Brom will have to ride on your back, Saphira. Brom sits up, wincing at the pain in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No, I’m fine. Really. We must leave quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where do we go?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Teirm. I have an old friend there. EXT. THE PLAIN’S - DAY Eragon and Brom ride their horses quickly across the plai Brom is leaned over. He’s holding his arm.  68. EXT. THE PLAIN’S - LATER Eragon and Brom continue to ride across the plains. EXT. THE PLAIN’S - LATER About a mile ahead of Eragon and Brom, the edge of mounta can be seen. Both of their horses quicken their speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom ride across the front field of TEIRM. Beh the city lies the ocean, sparkling in the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom slow their horses down to a walk. Eragon looks at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Will we go by our own names?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No. People have a tendency to remember things they shouldn’t. I will be Neal and you will be my nephew Evan. Eragon looks up at the sky. For just a second, though the clouds, Eragon sees Saphira’s body fly by. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You should land somewhere and hide. We’re going in.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Sticking your noses where it doesn’t belong...again! Eragon opens his eyes and shakes his head with a slight smile. After a moment, Eragon and Brom come to the front gate of Teirm.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom slowly ride through the gate. The guards them suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom slowly ride down the crowded streets. Amo the ROOFTOPS, KNIGHTS are stationed. All along the street Knights can be seen standing around. Everyone seems to have an unpleasant look about them.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: This place looks ready for war.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Teirm has a history of getting attacked by Pirates, Urgal’s, and other enemies. Teirm is the center of commerce Conflict will always arise where riches are so abundant.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Oh... Eragon and Brom continue to ride down the street. After a moment, Brom turns down another street. Eragon realizes i and starts to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: My old friend lives down this road, if I remember correctly. EXT. JEOD’S HOUSE - TEIRM - LATER JEOD’s HOUSE is two stories high and is connected to buildings on the left and right. It looks to be lived in someone rich. Brom knocks on the wooden door. After a moment, he knocks again. A moment later, the sounds of feet moving toward t door can be heard. The door slightly cracks open. Through the crack, we can the eyes of JEOD (55), a gray haired and weary looking ma  70.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD
dialogues.text: Who is it? Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD
dialogues.text: Well, then you’1l have to come back at a later time. I’m very busy. Jeod starts to close the door, but Brom stops it with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Won’t you let us in for only a moment. We’ve come a long way to see you and can’t stay long. Jeod opens the door a bit more. His eyes widen as he sees Brom.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD
dialogues.text: Brom?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Shh...I don’t want anyone to know our names. Jeod opens the door enough that he can get a good look at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD
dialogues.text: I--I--thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: It’s been a long time... Jeod looks around the street wearily and then motions for Brom and Eragon to come inside.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD
dialogues.text: Please, come in. INT. JEOD’S HOUSE - SAME TIME Jeod, Brom, and Eragon walk down a long HALLWAY. Eragon l around curiously. After a moment, they all come to a stop in front of a lar wooden double-door.  71. Brom looks down at Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Eragon, why don’t you look around outside for a little while at let us talk about a few things. Eragon nods his head and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Try not to draw attention to yourself, though. I don’t want anyone knowing we’re here. Eragon nods his head again and then turns to walk out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks out of Jeod’s house and into the street. He looks around. Connected to the right of Jeod’s house is a small SHOP. Inside through small windows, PLANTS can be s Eragon waits a moment and then walks toward the door of t Shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon walks in through the door and walks through the sm Shop. All around, plants and flowers sit on small, wooden table. After a moment, a large WERECAT, a slightly abnormal look cat like creature, walks up and purrs at Eragon. Eragon l down at it. Eragon closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I am a friend. After a moment, a voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do that. Eragon opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Saphira?  72. Eragon looks around. After a moment, he closes his eyes again. Eragon looks around and sees what looks like a woo rod. He reaches out for it

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That wouldn’t be wise. Eragon looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Stop playing games Saphira. Eragon turns and reaches for the wooden rod again. He gra it. Suddenly, a shock of electricity shoots through Erago He falls to the ground, writhing. After a moment he stops The Cat walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You aren’t very smart for a dragon Rider. I did warn you. Eragon’s eyes get big.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You said that!

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But you’re just a cat! The Werecat jumps on Eragon’s chest and sticks its claws him.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Do I look like other cats to you?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Then what makes you think I am one? Eragon starts to say something, but the Werecat digs its claws into his chest even more.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I-to correct you-am a Werecat. There aren’t many of us left, but I would have thought a farm boy would have heard of us.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were real.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Knowing and being are two different things. I didn’t know you existed before you came in here and ruined my nap, but that doesn’t mean you were real does it?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I disturbed you.

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was getting up anyway. The Werecat jumps off Eragon and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wait! What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: WERECAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You may call me Solembum. Suddenly, a woman walks up to Eragon. This is ANGELA (30) blond haired and slightly crazy looking woman. Eragon looks up at her and jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...I was...

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Talking to the Werecat?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: You can talk to him too?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Of course! Anyone can. That doesn’t mean he’1l talk back, though. There’s a bit of silence.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Now tell me, I haven’t seen you around here before. What brought you here and where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: The first I can’t answer and the second...my future is impossible to see....  74.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Well lets fix that. Eragon looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Angela sit around a small table. Angela is hol three bones.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Ready? Eragon nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Manin! Wyrda! Hugin! Angela throws the bones out onto the table. She studies t for a moment and then lets out a long sigh.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: This is the hardest reading I’ve ever done. You were right. Your future is nigh impossible to see. I’ve never seen someone’s fate so tangled. Eragon and Angela sit in silence for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Well- Angela points at one of the bones. ANGELA (CONT’D) I’1l start here, because its the easiest to understand. Angela stops for a moment and thinks.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Infinity or long life. It’s the first time I’ve ever seen it come up in a persons future. Angela puts her hand on the three bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the bones grow harder to read. Here the wandering path, lightning bolt, and sailing ship all lie together-a pattern I have never seen, only heard of. (Beat ) The wandering path means you have many choices in your future, some you are making even now. I see battles raging all around you. Many futures await you-all of them leading to blood and conflict. Angela closes her eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: The lightning bolt is a terrible omen. There is a doom upon you, but of what sort I know not. Part of it lies with in a death-one that rapidly approaches and will cause you much grief. But the rest awaits in a great journey. Look closely at this bone and you will see that it rest on the sailing ship, which is impossible to misunderstand. It means that you will leave this land forever, never to return. But to where is a mystery... Angela opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Next is a bit more pleasant. Angela smiles. ANGELA (CONT’D) An epic romance. I’m not sure if this love will end happily, but your love is of noble birth and heritage. Eragon smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Now, the last ones are the tree and the hawthorn root, which cross each other strongly. I wish this were not so-for it can only mean more trouble-but betrayal is clear (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGELA(cont'd) And it will come from within your family.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Roran wouldn’t do that!

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know...but the bones have never lied.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for reading my future. But I really must be going.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Your welcome! But tell me, what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Eva-I mean, Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Is that who you are or your name?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Smiling) Both.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Well, then, now I’m all the more interested in seeing how your life turns out. Eragon smiles. EXT. JEOD’S HOUSE - TEIRM - DAY Eragon walks up onto the porch and into the house. INT. JEOD’S HOUSE - TEIRM - DAY Eragon walks down the hallway and comes to the large doub door. He is about to open it but hears Brom and Jeod’s vo inside. He stops and looks through the crack in the middl the door.

dialogues.speaker: JEOD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So our...friends knew that you were alive all along?

dialogues.speaker: BROM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes.  77. Jeod and Brom continue to talk, but low enough that they cannot be understood. Eragon steps back with a confused look on his face. After moment, he steps forward and walks into the large OFFICE. Books and scrolls are stacked all around the walls and in book cases. A small desk sits in front of a large window (that is closed). Brom and Jeod are sitting in two rockin chairs opposite of each other. Brom and Jeod stop talking when Eragon comes in. They loo at him. EXT. JEOD’S HOUSE - TEIRM - NIGHT The streets are no longer crowded. No one can be seen exc for Knights scattered all over the roof tops of the city. INT. JEOD’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Eragon and Brom are each sitting in two chairs in front o small fireplace. Behind them are two small beds and a win but that’s it. Eragon looks at Brom, who is staring into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Brom?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Who are your...friends that Jeod was talking about earlier? Brom doesn’t answer for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: He was talking about the Varden.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I heard talk about them back at Thorns bar. Everyone says that they seek to destroy us all.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No...they seek to destroy evil...King Galbatorix.  78.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Will we go to them after the Raz’zac are destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: They lie somewhere in the Beor Mountains, across the Hadarack desert. Eragon sits back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: You best get some rest. We leave tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom ride quickly across the front field of Te

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom ride down a small path cut into the side the MOUNTAIN. Mountains surround them everywhere in the background. Above them, Saphira can be seen flying through the clouds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Brom are sitting beside a small fire. Eragon l up at Brom.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I had an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: What kind of idea?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Is it possible to conjure an image of something you can’t see with magic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you are talking about is scrying. It can be extremely helpful, but it has its drawbacks. If you were to scry the Raz’zac, you wouldn’t be able to see their surroundings because you haven’t seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: How does it work? Do you make an image in thin air?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Not usually. It’s easier to do it in a reflective surface such as a pool of water or mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: May I try it?

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: No, not now. You’re tired, and scrying takes lots of strength. I will tell you the words you have to say, but you must promise me you will not attempt it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I promise. Brom leans forward a bit.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Draumr kopa. 79. Eragon closes his eyes and mouths the words a few times t memorize it.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Maybe tomorrow I can scry Roran. I’m afraid that the Raz’zac might go after him. Brom leans back and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to frighten you, but that is a distinct possibility. Although Roran was gone while the Raz’zac were in Caravahall, I’m sure they still asked questions about him. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROM(cont 'd) If they get frustrated enough they’1l go back and interrogate Roran. It’s only a matter of time. In the darkness of the forest that grows on the Mountain side, a loud rustling can be heard. Brom looks into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: (Whispering) What was that? Eragon looks over into the forest

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: BROM
dialogues.text: Must have been a bird or something. I thought I saw something, though. Suddenly, Eragon screams out in pain and falls to the gro unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERAGON’S POV: Eragon’s eyes open. His vision is blurry for a few moment but it clears up after a moment, and everything comes int view. END ERAGON’S POV: Tears are rushing out of Eragon’s eyes. He winces at the in the back of his head, where a bunch of dried up blood After a moment, he begins to panic as he realizes that hi arms and legs are tied together. He looks around and sees Brom is tied up, but is unconscious. A hissing laugh can be heard off screen. Out from the woo walks two Raz’zac. One is slightly taller than the other. The tall Raz’zac walks over to Eragon, who is struggling get free. RAZ’AC #1 None of that now. The second and shorter Raz’zac walks over to Brom and dra him a few feet in front of Eragon.  81. The Raz’zac pulls Brom’s head back and holds a dagger to throat. Just then, an ARROW flies out of nowhere and stri the Raz’zac in the shoulder. He lets out a loud howl and drops to the ground, avoiding another arrow. The taller Raz’zac rushes over to the shorter one and pul him behind a small rock a few feet away. Brom stands up and stumbles toward Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Get down! Brom drops to his knees in front of Eragon. His eyes turn and become blood-shot. He falls forward. The Raz’zac’s da is sticking out of his back.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Screaming) No!!! Eragon’s head slowly falls backward and then passes out again. BLACK SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon opens his eyes slowly and realizes where he is. He lying on the ground in a large CAVE. Beside him lies Saph asleep. Eragon looks around and sees a young man, MURTAGH (20), a black haired man with battered clothes, sitting by a smal fire. In Murtagh’s lap is a BOW, and behind him is a gray hours called TORNAC.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Who are you? Murtagh tightens his grip on his Bow.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAGH
dialogues.text: Murtagh.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why did you help us?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAGH
dialogues.text: You aren’t the only enemies of the Raz’ zac.  82. After a moment, Eragon stands up and tries to walk, but f backward as pain explodes in his side. He yelps as he fal to the ground. Murtagh tries to run over to Eragon, but Saphira blocks h way and lets out a loud “growl!”

dialogues.speaker: MURTAGH
dialogues.text: I would have helped you earlier, but your dragon wouldn’t let me.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Wincing) Her name’s Saphira. Eragon looks up at Saphira.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now let him through! He saved our lives! Saphira lets out another “growl” and moves out of the way Murtagh quickly walks over to Eragon and helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: How is Brom? Eragon, with Murtagh’s help, walks over to Brom, who is sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAGH
dialogues.text: I was only able to heal what was on the surface. I don’t know what damage may have been caused on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is lying by the fire, asleep. Murtagh is lying on other side of the fire, also asleep. Eragon roles over. His eyes flicker behind the lids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arya is lying on a small, brick bed that hangs from the w by two chains.  83. Arya’s face is bruised and has dried blood on it. Arya lo up toward us. Sadness covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (Filtered) Eragon, wake up! (Beat ) Wake up! (Beat ) Eragon! Everything fades to WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Eragon is sleeping in a small cave-like bedroom. The open of the cave reveals, a thousand feet down, the city of Tronjheim. Eragon opens his eyes. Standing in front of him is Orik

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: If you’1l get ready, we’1ll get you some breakfast and then begin your training. Your dragon can stay here. Eragon rubs his face and then sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Orik are walking through the large city. Peasa stare at Eragon with smiles. Mixed in with the Varden Peasants are DWARF WOMAN AND CHILDREN, who seem to be ignoring Eragon. In front of Eragon is a Woman Peasant with a little BABY in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Will you bless this child, Argetlam? There is no one to care for her but me. Please, Argetlam. Bless her for luck! Eragon looks surprised and confused. A few moments pass.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Bless her, Argetlam, bless her. Eragon hesitantly puts his palm on the Baby’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Atra gulia un ilian tauthr ono un atra ono waise skolir fra rauthr. (Beat ) That is all I can do for her.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Argetlam. The Woman walks away.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of Varden Soldiers are training in a large marke off field. In the background, the small Houses can be see people walking all around them. Eragon walks across the field, Orik in front of him. Erag bends down to Orik.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Orik.

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: That woman...she called me Argetlam. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: It means Silver Palm. Eragon straightens up as they come to the center of the field. Arya is standing there waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: (Surprised) You’re awake!

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Eragon, for saving me. Eragon looks at Arya’s face, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Shall we begin? Eragon backs up, drawing Zar’roc from his side. Arya draw black-handled thin SWORD from her back and holds it out i front of her. Eragon looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hur- Arya jumps forward, jabbing her sword toward Eragon’s stomach. Eragon, surprised, jumps back. Arya’s sword barely misses him.  106. Eragon swings Zar’roc at Arya. She quickly hits it aside swings her sword toward Eragon. Eragon blocks it. Suddenly, Arya spins her sword around, flinging Zar’roc o of Eragon’s hand. Arya pokes Eragon in the stomach, victorious. Eragon looks embarrassed. Orik steps up beside Eragon.

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: My King, Hrothgar, wishes to see you, Eragon. EXT. HROTHGAR’S THRONE ROOM - DAY A beautiful THRONE sits at the center of the back of the large, stone THRONE ROOM. In the throne is KING HROTHGAR, old, small DWARF dressed in beautiful armor. A large bear grows from his face. On the opposite side of the room is a huge STONE DOOR, wh swings open after a moment, revealing Eragon and Saphira, walk slowly toward Hrothgar. Both of them stop before the throne and bow.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: I could not meet with you earlier as Ajihad did, because I had to deal with my enemies in a few of the dwarf clans. They say I should deny you and expel you from Farthen Dur.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I am sorry for the trouble my arrival has caused everyone.

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: We will soon have greater problems. War is coming. We must be ready. You must be ready. Eragon stands in fear for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: I will be.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is lying on the ground beside Saphira. They are bo asleep. Suddenly, a LANTERN comes into view. Holding it is Orik Eragon slightly opens his eyes, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: You and your dragon must come quickly!

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ORIK
dialogues.text: Ajihad summons you to Fathen Dur. Eragon sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon and Saphira follow Orik, who is walking very quick through the Tunnel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six thousand Varden Soldiers and DWARVEN WARRIORS are cro together. At the very front of the army is Ajihad, Arya, and Hrothg A few Dwarf Warriors step forward in front of Saphira and Eragon as they walk toward Ajihad and the others.

dialogues.speaker: DWARF WARRIOR
dialogues.text: We must take your dragon.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HROTHGAR
dialogues.text: To dress her in the ancient armor Eragon nods and the Dwarf Warriors walk away, Saphira fol them.  Eragon walks up to Ajihad, fear in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: AJIHAD
dialogues.text: A group of dwarfs spotted thousands of Urgal’s and Kull marching through the underground tunnels. They will be here within the hour.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: They outnumber us?

dialogues.speaker: AJIHAD
dialogues.text: Yes. (Beat ) We have collapsed the tunnels that lead to the city of Tronjheim. They will have no choice but to come from those tunnels. (Beat ) Once they come, we must keep them from ever getting to Tronjheim. If they get there, they will kill the woman and children. 108. Ajihad points into the distance, where large TUNNEL DOORS are. Ajihad turns and puts his hand on the shoulder of a MAN.

dialogues.speaker: AJIHAD
dialogues.text: Eragon, this Jormunder, my most trusted advisor and second in command of the Varden. Eragon nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is silent. The Varden Soldiers look scared. Eragon, now wearing armor, is standing beside a fully arm Saphira. Suddenly, from the Tunnel Doors light begins to flicker. loud yells of the Urgal’s and Kull can be heard. Arya looks into the distance, at the Tunnel Doors.  109.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: (Sorrowfully) It has begun. Ajihad looks at the Tunnel Doors.

dialogues.speaker: AJIHAD
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Weapons! The Varden Soldiers draw their swords and the Dwarf Warri draw their AXES. Ajihad, Arya, Jormunder, and Hrothgar draw their weapons. Eragon climbs on top of Saphira and draws Zar’roc. A long moment of silence passes and then...the Urgal’s ch out of the Tunnel Doors! They run, weapons drawn toward t Varden Soldiers. Ajihad lifts his sword in the air.

dialogues.speaker: AJIHAD
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Charge! Ajihad begins to run. The entire army follows him. Saphira jumps into the air, Eragon on her back, and dives toward the Urgal army. A moment passes...and then the two armies crash into each other! Saphira grabs three Urgal’s in her claws and throws them the walls, killing them. She then dives down and grabs tw Urgal’s in her mouth and crushes them. From Saphira’s back, Eragon hacks at an Urgal with Zar’ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira lands, swinging her tail at ten Kull, slinging th into fifteen more Urgal’s. After a moment, Saphira jumps back into the air. A Kull h Eragon in the chest with a large CLUB, sending Eragon fly into the ground. Saphira continues to fly upward. Eragon fights off a few Urgal’s.  110.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Saphira, I need you! Behind Eragon, an Urgal lifts it’s sword, ready to drop i into Eragon’s head. Suddenly, a blade hits it’s throat, sending it’s head fly off. Eragon turns around, revealing Angela, dressed in a black robe and holding a double-bladed staff sword. Angela smil and then continues to fight. Saphira drops down and crashes into a few Urgals and then lands beside Eragon. Eragon climbs onto Saphira and they take off again, flyin high into the air, a flock of ARROWS follow them. Arya is surrounded by hundreds of Urgal’s and Kull. She continues to fight, but looks tired. Suddenly, Saphira lands beside Arya, crushing five Urgal’

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Get on! Arya turns and jumps onto Saphira. Suddenly, a Kull’s axe hits Saphira’s chest armor, dentin inward. Saphira grows loudly and grabs the Kull in her mo crushing him. Saphira jumps into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: SAPHIRA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It hurts to breath.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Can you get us to the dragon hold? Saphira soars through the air for a moment and then dives down and flies through two large DOORS, revealing Tronjhe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saphira lands on the ground.  111.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I will go with her. You must stay and fight.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Thank you. Eragon jumps off of Saphira and lands on the ground. Saphira jumps into the air and flies straight up. All aro her, implanted into the walls is pure SAPPHIRE, sparkling Eragon begins to run toward the two large Doors, holding Zar’roc. Suddenly, behind him, Tronjheims floor begins to crack. Eragon stops and turns around. An AXE bust through the surface of Tronjheims floor. The sound of Urgal’s can be heard. After a moment, the Urgal’s begin to climb up through the hole in the floor. Eragon charges toward them, hacking in them with Zar’roc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle continues to rage. Hrothgar swings his large Hammar at a few Kull, crushing their armor and killing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon is fighting Urgal’s as the come through the hole i the ground. A few minutes of fighting pass and then the Urgal’s stop coming through the hole. Eragon sighs and bends over, breathing heavily. After a moment, he turns and runs toward the two Doors. Behind him, there is a loud CRACK! Eragon turns around. A dark FIGURE stands in the dust. The Figure steps forward, revealing that its...Durza! Eragon gasps in fear  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ajihad swings his sword into a Kull, it falls to the grou Angela is battling off dozens of Urgal’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eragon takes a step back. Durza slowly walks toward him, drawing his sword.

dialogues.speaker: DURZA
dialogues.text: You will die today, Rider. Durza lifts his sword up and swings it at Eragon. Eragon pulls Zar’roc up, blocking Durza’s blade, but the force behind the blow sends Eragon back a few feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Varden Soldier is fighting a large Kull. After a few moments, the Kull slices the Varden Soldiers head off. Orik jumps off of a large rock and lands on an Urgal, sticking his Axe into it’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durza and Eragon continue to fight, Durza obviously winni Eragon looks tired and worn. A moment passes and then Durza steps forward and pushes Eragon backwards, causing him to trip. Eragon falls to hi knees. Durza swings his sword and the side of the blade sticks i Eragon’s back. Eragon lets out a horrible cry of pain. BEGIN ERAGON’S POV: Everything is blurry. Durza is smiling. Suddenly, Durza j back as a huge piece of Sapphire hits the ground. END ERAGON’S POV: Hundreds of pieces of Sapphire begins to hit the ground. Eragon looks up, tears in his eyes.  113. Saphira, with Arya on her back, is flying straight toward ground. Suddenly, Saphira opens her mouth and a huge explosion of flames come from it! Durza ducks and drops to the ground to avoid being hit by flame. Eragon grabs Zar’roc of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON
dialogues.text: Brisingr! Zar’roc’s blade lights up with BLUE FLAMES. Eragon lets o scream as he sticks it into Durza’s heart. Durza looks down in shock and then lets out a loud cry. Eragon collapses.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Flashes of light distort everything and ten fade out. Suddenly, a voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Come to me. A moment passes. More light flashes and distorts everythi

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Eragon, come to me.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I am the cripple who is whole. (Beat ) You must trust Arya and go to the Elven Kingdom of Ellesmera. (Beat ) You have wrought the land of a great evil, Eragon. Many are in your debt. More flashes of light distort everything.  114.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Come to me, Eragon. I have answers to all you ask. A moment of silence passes. Eragon’s head comes into view but nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: ERAGON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I will come. FADE OUT. The End
